Source: vignettes/summary_service.Rmd
summary_service.Rmd

R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

library(dataRetrieval)


for (i in c(55, 27, 19)) {
  state_cd <- stateCd$STATE[i]
  state_nm <- stateCd$STUSAB[i]

  df_summary <- tryCatch(
    {
      readWQPsummary(
        statecode = state_cd,
        CharacteristicName = "Nitrogen",
        siteType = "Stream"
      )
    },
    error = function(cond) {
      message(paste("No data in:", state_nm))
      break()
    }
  )

  sites <- df_summary |>
    filter(
      YearSummarized >= 1995,
      YearSummarized <= 2020
    ) |>
    group_by(MonitoringLocationIdentifier, MonitoringLocationName) |>
    summarise(
      start_year = min(YearSummarized, na.rm = TRUE),
      end_year = max(YearSummarized, na.rm = TRUE),
      count_activity = sum(ActivityCount, na.rm = TRUE),
      count_result = sum(ResultCount, na.rm = TRUE)
    ) |>
    ungroup() |>
    filter(count_activity >= 40)

  if (nrow(sites) > 0) {
    df_state <- tryCatch(
      {
        readWQPdata(
          siteid = sites$MonitoringLocationIdentifier,
          CharacteristicName = "Nitrogen",
          startDateLo = "1995-01-01",
          startDateHi = "2020-12-31",
          sampleMedia = "Water",
          ignore_attributes = FALSE
        )
      },
      error = function(cond) {
        message(paste("No data in:", state_nm))
      }
    )
  }

  if (nrow(df_state) > 0) {
    saveRDS(df_state, file = paste0(state_nm, "_raw_data.rds"))
  } else {
    message("No data in:", state_nm)
  }
}
## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'MonitoringLocationIdentifier'. You can
## override using the `.groups` argument.
## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'MonitoringLocationIdentifier'. You can
## override using the `.groups` argument.
## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'MonitoringLocationIdentifier'. You can
## override using the `.groups` argument.

Combine the data

Talk about how to combine the data:

all_data <- data.frame()
for (i in c(55, 27, 19)) {
  state_nm <- stateCd$STUSAB[i]
  df_state <- readRDS(paste0(state_nm, "_raw_data.rds"))
  all_data <- bind_rows(all_data, df_state)
}
